answers.answer: An allergy to the food or something in the processed foods can cause neuro issues....do speak with ur Dr regarding this issue.Good luck"selma"

Hi there.  tingling in feet after eating tinned food could be attributed to food poisoning which is caused by infectious organisms and illness caused by chemicals. Symptoms can vary from nausea followed by forceful vomiting, frequent diarrhea, painful cramps, fever, dizziness and tingling in hands and feet. So it would be prudent to consult a physician to check your stool specimen and evidence of the organism. If there is no suggestion of poisoning, you need to consider vitamin B 12 deficiencies, diabetes, hypothyroidism and rheumatoid arthritis. Hope this helps. Take care.

question: does anyone have tingling in feet after eating processed food?
title: What causes tingling in my feet after eating processed food?
